Description: Rim sherd of Chian black-figured Mature Animal Style or Sphinx and Lion Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black (mostly worn) below; at bottom of sherd, trace of motif in added white and red; exterior: slip partly worn; trace of glaze on top of rim; around rim, band of chequers with dotted blanks above broken maeander between brown lines; below: black-figure decoration consisting of possible floral motif; pendant incised rosette and other floral motif with red dot as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd does not fit into any specific Chian type but rather takes elements from several different styles. The rim pattern is typical of the Wild Goat Style but the interior decoration is not consistent with that style. Rather, it belongs in the Mature Animal Style and Grand Style, as does the shape of the vessel. Black figure decoration is not typical of the Mature Animal Style but rather the contemporary Sphinx and Lion Style. For other vessels displaying a similar mixture of styles, see British Museum 1965,0930.305 and 1924,1201.208.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1557) (phase 2)
